body_html:
If tensorflow is published as a dll file, I agree.

However, since it is released as source code, there is no real 'internal'. Whoever downloaded the code can modify it to make use of the internal code, which is often very necessary (like the tf status to grpc status conversion) My point is simply, if it is impossible to enforce what is 'internal', why not just remove the visibility constraints, making advanced user's life a bit simpler? After all, people who only use the public interface would not care whether the code is internal or not
